section.name: AccessPlatform : What's New in 4.0
section.p: DataNucleus AccessPlatform version 4.0 extends the 3.3 capabilities with significant internal refactoring. Below are some of the new features you can find in DataNucleus AccessPlatform 4.0.

ul.li: Upgrade to ASM v5 to allow for Java 1.8 bytecode changes
Support for multicolumn TypeConverters (used by RDBMS, Cassandra)
SchemaTool : support for create/delete of a schema (where the datastore supports it)
RDBMS : ability to use single connection per PM/EM (rather than 1 for transactional operations, and 1 for non-transactional operations)
RDBMS : removed the need to create JavaTypeMapping classes when the user type has a TypeConverter
